intro: Cyclanthera australis, commonly known as the Australian horned melon, is a climbing vine native to Australia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and pumpkins. The plant produces distinctive, spiny fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with five lobes. Cyclanthera australis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry, rocky areas.
